poem:
In Bordered Flight  

Here, the chill breath of freedom  
drifts northward. People, packed,  
small steps tracing broad circles—  
Fear crosses borders quietly.  
  
The land of maple whispers softly,  
calling those who yearn escape  
from words, sharp like frostbitten leaves,  
to settle in tender loam,  
find solace beneath the northern sky.
